page.title: 03Hesketh Golf Course
page.content: In 1885 Hesketh Golf Course was built on sand dunes so it was a golf links. The modern club house was built in 1903. There are about 450 members in the Golf Club. The playing times are 8.30 on normal days but on competition days it opens at 7.30 and it closes at dusk. The Golf Course used to be a place called Little Ireland where 60 to 80 people lived, and the greenkeeper's hut was the schoolhouse. Colonel Hesketh bought the course so nobody could build on it. In 1945 there was an atrocious flood on the Golf Course. It was caused by the sea coming over the sea wall and the water was about 9 feet deep.
